channel.title: Trump on Rob Barry
channel.description: Recent content in Trump on Rob Barry

item.title: Postal Service Is Ordered to Search for Remaining Ballots
item.description: A federal judge ordered the U.S. Postal Service to conduct rigorous sweeps of facilities serving states with looming election deadlines like Pennsylvania and North Carolina, so any ballots still in the system reach election officials in time. Read the full story here.

item.title: Millions of Mail-in Ballots at Risk in Battleground States
item.description: Millions of mail-in ballots haven’t been received by election offices in critical battleground states, where recent slowdowns in mail deliveries risk some votes not arriving in time to count for the presidential election. Read the full story here.

item.title: How Delayed Is Your Mail-In Ballot?
item.description: Of the 29 states that require mail-in ballots to arrive on or before election day, 28 have seen periods in recent weeks of average delivery times of more than six days, a Wall Street Journal analysis found. Read the full story here.

item.title: Evangelist's Account Spurred Stone to Seek Clinton Emails From WikiLeaks
item.description: Trump campaign adviser sought corroboration for Indian’s allegations against Hillary Clinton. Read the full story here.

item.title: Poll-Rigging for Trump and Creating @WomenForCohen: One IT Firm's Work Order
item.description: Behind the scenes, Michael Cohen hired RedFinch Solutions, then allegedly stiffed it–and his boss. Read the full story here.

item.title: Michael Cohen Guilty Plea Reveals Link to Qatari Royal Family
item.description: A $100,000 real-estate brokerage fee that was part of former Trump attorney Michael Cohen’s guilty plea came from representing a company owned by a member of the Qatar royal family. Read the full story here.

item.title: Roger Stone Sought Information on Clinton From Assange, Emails Show
item.description: Former Trump campaign adviser Roger Stone privately sought information he considered damaging to Hillary Clinton from WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange during the 2016 presidential campaign, according to emails reviewed by The Wall Street Journal. Read the full story here.
